title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 901.3 - Designations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 901.3 - Designations

State Regulations
(a) The records
access officer from whom access to such records may be obtained is the fund's
general counsel or assistant counsel. (1)

If
the records access officer does not provide or deny access to the record sought
within five business days of receipt of a request, he or she shall furnish a
written acknowledgment of receipt of the request and a statement of the
approximate date when the request will be granted or denied. If access to
records is neither granted nor denied within 10 business days after the date of
acknowledgment of receipt of a request, the request may be construed as a
denial of access that may be appealed. (b) The appeals officer to whom applicant may
direct an appeal from a denial of access is the fund's executive director. If
the executive director further denies such access, his reasons therefor shall
be explained in writing to applicant within seven business days of the receipt
of such appeal. (c) The fiscal
officer, charged with the duty of preparing payrolls, is the fund's
comptroller. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
901.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
